title: American_Top_40_1975_November_29th
description:
"Three hours once a week with American Top 40 and you know where your favorite records are on the national music scene."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

You will hear Casey say, "Hear's a band that calls itself KISS."

Casey answers the question, "What number one songs were the fastest and the slowest in falling off the hot 100 after leaving the number one position?" (Fastest was 3 weeks, slowest was 24).

A Beatles' fan wants to know, "During the rock era who, aside from the Beatles, has had the most top ten hits?" Casey says the Beatles did not have the most top ten hits!

A listener wants to know, "Who was the first Canadian artist to hit number one on the American charts?"
